meta.title: Migrate from Vert.x 3 to Vert.x 4
meta.summary: We provide a clear and well-documented migration path from Vert.x 3.9 to Vert.x 4. Existing users will feel at home with the new version.

meta.title: What's new in Vert.x 4.2
meta.summary: See an overview of all new and exciting features in Vert.x 4.2, including Java 17 support, Vert.x Oracle Client and more.

meta.title: Eclipse Vert.x 4.2.3 released!
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x version 4.2.3 has just been released.

meta.title: Things to keep in mind concerning CSRF attacks
meta.summary: Eclipse Vert.x like most frameworks provides an anti-CSRF defense. However, no framework can prevent all attack vectors that exist in the web. Therefore, developers need to be aware of some dangers and common attack vectors concerning CSRF defenses.

meta.title: Some Rest with Vert.x
meta.summary: This post is part of the Introduction to Vert.x series. Letâ€™s go a bit further this time and develop a CRUD-ish application

meta.title: Using the asynchronous SQL client
meta.summary: Finally, back... This post is the fifth post of the introduction to vert.x blog series, after a not-that-small break. In this post we are going to see how we can use JDBC in a vert.x application.
